result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Leamons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Treatment Court Hearing on August 17, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicole M Leamons in court with attorney Mark Gumz (standing in for Atty Ryan Frank).  Defendant Nicole M Leamons in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states there was a Treatment Court Meeting earlier today and the team has recommended that defendant not be terminated at this point.  Recommends release after vivatrol is given and she is to meet with Jim Webb at least 2 times per week.  Requests condition that she meet today with agent Wilcox.  Recommends conditions:  no romantic relationships for a period of time, no access to social media during this portion of treatment.  Further condition:  Law Enforcement may stop in an see her when they chose to check on her welfare.
Atty Gumz state he spoke with defendant about the conditions and if she wishes to have counsel appointed, they would take the time to do that.
Court makes statement to defendant.  Defendant agrees to the recommendations by the Team.
BY THE COURT:  Court will accept the recommendations of the Treatment Court Team.  Court will not terminate her at this point.  Court will defer the use of In-Patient treatment at this time.  Once the Vivitrol is administered, she may be released.  She is to meet with Jim Webb tomorrow and then 2 times per week after that.  She is to meet with Agent Wilcox immediately after today's hearing.  Conditions until decided upon by the Team are as follows:  *No romantic relations  *No use of social media  *Law Enforcement may stop by to do wellness checks at any time until further notice.  The SCRAM bracelet may be removed today.
Lifting Stay of Conditional Time s/BNB/6-22-17

Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Nicole M Leamons. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicole M Leamons in court.
Atty Hendee states that there was a discussion from the treatment court team and they have recommended sanctions for not calling in for testing.  Atty Hendee states that the recommendation is not remove SCRAM bracelet as planned and lift 4 days jail to serve forthwith; jail time will be served as trustee under the Marquette County jail staff.  Atty Hendee states that would be with huber.  Atty Frank states that the defendant just forgot to call in ; defendant would submit to a UA today and would leave the SCRAM bracelet on. Atty Hendee responds and asks that the court order the defendant to report forthwith to jail.  

BY THE COURT:  Court lift the stay and orders 4 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; stayed for 2 hours
Report forthwith
Defendant is to stay on the 2nd floor of the courthouse and find care for the children; if the defendant can not find child care then the court will contact Human Services and the children will be taken into custody.
SCRAM bracelet will be ordered to stay on.

Treatment Court Hearing on January 5, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicole M Leamons in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Nicole M Leamons in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
Atty Hendee states that there is resolution and it includes treatment court.  Atty Hendee states that the treatment court team has accepted the defendant.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Atty Frank agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.


Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks that the court place the defendant into Treatment Court Program.  Atty Hendee asks that when released; Ms. Leamons report to Ms. Runge to get a SCRAM bracelet and to contact Mr. Webb from Human Services.  Ms. Runge makes a statement.  Atty Hendee responds.  
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.  

BY THE COURT:  TREATMENT COURT:  
Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions;
*9 months in the Marquette County Jail; stayed for use of treatment court violations
*Credit = 80 days (if revoked)
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count
*Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Successful completion of the Treatment Court Program

As terms as the Probation hold pending decision by ALJ; the court orders the defendant to immediately meet with Ms. Runge and also see Jim Webb for treatment.  If the hold is lifted while the courthouse is closed; the court orders the defendant not to injest any controlled substance or possess any controlled substance.  Defendant is also to report to Ms. Runge on Tuesday morning for the SCRAM bracelet.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on December 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond
s/BNB/ 10-26-16
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Return date on December 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frank states that he was recently appointed on the case and asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued  Return date scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Statement of Compliance
s/CIJ, Victin Witness Coordinator
Return date on October 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

with conditions:
*No contact with M.K. or her residence

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.   Defendant does not answer. 

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial

Defendant Nicole M Leamons in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant gives her current address.


  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with M.K. or her residence
*Defendant may return to the residence one time with Law Enforcement to get her belongings; with prior notice to the victim.
*No possession or use of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Return date scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
